item.name: Device description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Device uptime
item.description: The time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Device contact details
item.description: The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device location
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device Maximum number of connection cache
item.description: Maximum number of connection cache entries allowed through the firewall

item.name: Device Current active connection cache
item.description: Number of active connection cache entries through the firewall

item.name: Device Serial Number
item.description: System serial number for this device

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Download - $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: MTU of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The size of the largest packet which can be sent/received on the interface, specified in octets. For interfaces that are used for transmitting network datagrams, this is the size of the largest network datagram that can be sent on the interface.

item_prototype.name: Status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Upload - $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: MacAddress of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The interface's address at its protocol sub-layer. For example, for an 802.x interface, this object normally contains a MAC address. The interface's media-specific MIB must define the bit and byte ordering and the format of the value of this object. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

item_prototype.name: Speed of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Download - $1
item_prototype.description: "The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can ccur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime."

item_prototype.name: Upload - $1
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Speed of interface $1
item_prototype.description: An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to `n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nomina bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: MTU of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The size of the largest packet which can be sent/received on the interface, specified in octets. For interfaces that are used for transmitting network datagrams, this is the size of the largest network datagram that can be sent on the interface.

item_prototype.name: Name of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The textual name of the interface

item_prototype.name: Status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: MacAddress of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The interface's address at its protocol sub-layer. For example, for an 802.x interface, this object normally contains a MAC address. The interface's media-specific MIB must define the bit and byte ordering and the format of the value of this object. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

trigger.name: Consumo de CPU superior a 90% por 5 minutos.
Consumo de memria superior a 90% por 5 minutos
Nmero de conexes simultneas ultrapassou {$CONEXOES_ELEVADAS}, valor atual {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
